meanings.definition: Emitting light as a result of being heated
meanings.sent1: The incandescent light bulb illuminated the room.
meanings.sent2: The campfire was incandescent in the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent3: The incandescent toaster made breakfast more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as incandescent as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The incandescent stars twinkled in the clear sky.

meanings.sent1: The incandescent iron glowed red hot.
meanings.sent2: The incandescent embers of the fire warmed us.
meanings.sent3: The incandescent stove turned the kitchen into a sauna.
meanings.sent4: His anger was incandescent, burning brightly in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The incandescent lava flowed down the volcano's slopes.

meanings.sent1: The incandescent sun shone down on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The incandescent diamond sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent3: The incandescent smile on her face lit up the room.
meanings.sent4: The incandescent moonlight bathed the garden in silver.
meanings.sent5: The incandescent fireworks painted the sky with colors.
